lines.gurmukhi: Agm Apwr dyv AlK AByv Aiq Aink jqn kir ingH n pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Agam Apaar Dayv Alakh Abhayv Ati , Anik Jatan Kari Nigrah N Paaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord who is highly inaccessible, infinite, light effulgent and beyond comprehension, cannot be reached by controlling the senses with all available means.

lines.gurmukhi: pweIAY n jg Bog pweIAY n rwj jog nwd bwd byd kY Aghu n ghweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Paaeeai N Jag Bhog Paaeeai N Raaj Joga , Naad Baad Bayd Kai Agahu N Gahaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He cannot even be realised through holding/performing of Yag, hom (offerings to fire god), holding of feast for holy men, nor through Raj Yog. He cannot be reached through playing of musical instruments nor recitation of Vedas.

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ purb dyv dyv syvkY n pweIAY krm Drm bRq nym ilv lweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Purab Dayv Dayv Sayvakai N Paaeeai , Karam Dharam Brat Naym Liv Laaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such God of gods can also not be reached by visiting places of pilgrimage, celebrating days considered auspicious or by the service of gods. Even fasts of myriad kind cannot even bring Him closer. Contemplations are futile as well.

lines.gurmukhi: inhPl Aink pRkwr kY Acwr sbY swvDwn swDsMg huie sbd gweIAY ]304]
lines.transliteration_english: Nihadhal Anik Prakaar Kai Achaar Sabai , Saavadhaan Saadhasang Hui Sabad Gaaeeai ?304?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the methods of God-realisation are of no use. He can only be realised by singing His paeans in the company of holy men and meditating on Him with concentrated and singular mind. (304)
